verses.roman:
dui śloka kahi' prabhura haila mahā-sukha
nija-bhaktera guna kahe hañā pañca-mukha

synonyms: dui śloka kahi'-reciting two verses; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; haila—there was; mahā-sukha—great pleasure; nija-bhaktera—of His own devotee; guṇa—the qualities; kahe—describes; hañā—as if becoming; pañca-mukha—five-mouthed.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu recited the two important verses, He felt great pleasure; thus, as if He had five mouths, He began to praise His devotee.

purport.content: The two verses referred to are those beginning with priyaḥ so 'yam (79) and tuṇḍe tāṇḍavinī (99).
